Who did Xerath betray?
{{champion:268}}

Cassiopeia betrayed Sivir, so she sold her soul.

Xerath betrayed Azir, so he sold his soul.

Zed betrayed Shen so he sold his soul.

Hecarim betrayed Mordekaiser so he sold his soul.

Twisted Fate betrayed Graves so he sold his soul.

Lissandra betrayed the Freljord, so Ashe (potentially) sold her soul.

LeBlanc betrayed Boram Darkwill, so his son sold his soul.

All of the characters who were betrayed are champions… So is Boram Darkwill's son going to be a champion?

>no {{champion:19}} 
rito plz
Would Renekton also be a candidate for betraying his Brother?
Yes but {{champion:75}} still loves {{champion:58}} even though hes insane someone has to put a hit on renekton and nasus would never do that because he wants to save his brother
I think the new lore changed that, now it was Nasus that had to trap renekton with xerath, renekton himself hasn't done anything yet.

Yeah, although I guess Renekton could technically be considered a betrayer, since he is trying to kill him now, but eons ago he volunteered to stay and guard Xerath's tomb. Unfortunately, years in isolation has poisoned his mind and he seeks vengence on Nasus for what happened. It's actually an improvement on the old lore, since Renekton starts more complex here and is just twisted by his own insanity.

Graves is, himself, a scourge, an outlaw, and a confidence trickster. Like Twisted Fate himself, I'm sure Graves has the confidence that he can handle this feud on his own, and won't need to resort to outside help.
they spelled "evidenced" wrong

evinced: past tense form of the word 'evince'
evince: verb, to reveal the presences of *or* to be evidence of; indicate.
